We will denote the pegs as:
*   **L:** Left Peg (Source)
*   **M:** Middle Peg (Auxiliary)
*   **R:** Right Peg (Destination)

The disks are A (smallest) through D (largest).

## [PLAN]

The plan is executed in 15 steps:

| Step | Disk to Move | From Peg | To Peg | Goal/Comment |
| :---: | :---: | :---: | :---: | :--- |
| **Phase 1: Move the top 3 disks (A, B, C) from L to M using R.** (7 moves) |
| 1 | A | L | M | Clear B (sub-group A, B) |
| 2 | B | L | R | Clear C |
| 3 | A | M | R | Stack A on B (A, B ready for transfer) |
| 4 | C | L | M | Move C to its intermediate destination |
| 5 | A | R | L | Clear B (sub-group A, B) from R |
| 6 | B | R | M | Stack B on C |
| 7 | A | L | M | Stack A on B. **(L holds D; M holds A, B, C)** |
| **Phase 2: Move the largest disk (D) from L to R.** (1 move) |
| 8 | D | L | R | **(R holds D; M holds A, B, C)** |
| **Phase 3: Move the 3 disks (A, B, C) from M to R using L.** (7 moves) |
| 9 | A | M | R | Clear B (sub-group A, B) from M |
| 10 | B | M | L | Clear C |
| 11 | A | R | L | Stack A on B |
| 12 | C | M | R | Move C onto D |
| 13 | A | L | M | Clear B (sub-group A, B) from L |
| 14 | B | L | R | Stack B onto C |
| 15 | A | M | R | Stack A onto B. **(R holds A, B, C, D)** |

The goal is achieved in 15 moves. Both the left peg and the middle peg are empty.
